channel.title: Comments on: That’s Fine, Learn 2 Patch

item.title: By: Michael
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: Don't forget to mention that the forums have been broken all day too!
item.content:encoded: Don’t forget to mention that the forums have been broken all day too!

item.title: By: Staarkhand
item.dc:creator: Staarkhand
item.description:
No idea where to reliably find archives of the For Really patch notes, I read it on my guild website as I was downloading (usually by the time I get home from work someone has a mirror up), and confirmed it by reading the notes as it installed.
I suppose I should note that SnD now supposedly can trigger Ruthlessness. So overall probably a net gain for rogues this patch.
item.content:encoded:
No idea where to reliably find archives of the For Really patch notes, I read it on my guild website as I was downloading (usually by the time I get home from work someone has a mirror up), and confirmed it by reading the notes as it installed.

I suppose I should note that SnD now supposedly can trigger Ruthlessness. So overall probably a net gain for rogues this patch.

item.title: By: Foton
item.dc:creator: Foton
item.description: And suddenly, a new blog slave emerges. Thanks Uruloki!
item.content:encoded: And suddenly, a new blog slave emerges. Thanks Uruloki!

item.title: By: uruloki
item.dc:creator: uruloki
item.description:
Here's the comparison:
http://www.gameaholic.com/world-of-warcraft-v1.9-patch-notes-differences.html
Mostly grammar changes, but there are a few big ones like the Troll racial hidden in there.
item.content:encoded:
Here’s the comparison:

item.title: By: Foton
item.dc:creator: Foton
item.description:
Those were labeled the live patch notes. Is there some secret place that Blizzard hides the complete, real live patch notes?
If I have to compare several sets of notes for each patch, I'm going to have to kidnap another blog slave.
item.content:encoded:
Those were labeled the live patch notes. Is there some secret place that Blizzard hides the complete, real live patch notes?

If I have to compare several sets of notes for each patch, I’m going to have to kidnap another blog slave.

item.title: By: Staarkhand
item.dc:creator: Staarkhand
item.description:
Foton, every patch notes I can google up agrees with you, but I think those are carried over from the test client notes and when it went live yesterday the ACTUAL notes had different info on the troll racial beserking. I didn't have a chance to test it, but I know this is so relevant to you alliance types I just have to post.
As I recall: Scales from 10-30% haste depending on your hp when activated No longer requires being crit Requires energy/rage/mana 3 min cooldown instead of 2
In other words, I might actually use it, possibly every cooldown depending on the energy cost.
Also in the world of rogues, no more SnD on dead mobs, and our Tier 2 set received the only nerf in the form of decreased proc rate from the 8 item bonus, although I'm also hearing that it now crits based on your base crit % instead of 5% and so the damage stayed about even. Not that there's a large population with 8 piece Bloodfang, but I have to ask who decided that proc rate was causing rogues to be overpowered.
item.content:encoded:
Foton, every patch notes I can google up agrees with you, but I think those are carried over from the test client notes and when it went live yesterday the ACTUAL notes had different info on the troll racial beserking. I didn’t have a chance to test it, but I know this is so relevant to you alliance types I just have to post.

As I recall:
Scales from 10-30% haste depending on your hp when activated
No longer requires being crit
Requires energy/rage/mana
3 min cooldown instead of 2

In other words, I might actually use it, possibly every cooldown depending on the energy cost.

Also in the world of rogues, no more SnD on dead mobs, and our Tier 2 set received the only nerf in the form of decreased proc rate from the 8 item bonus, although I’m also hearing that it now crits based on your base crit % instead of 5% and so the damage stayed about even. Not that there’s a large population with 8 piece Bloodfang, but I have to ask who decided that proc rate was causing rogues to be overpowered.

item.title: By: Saccia
item.dc:creator: Saccia
item.description: Eh, I'll just continue to play <a href="http://www.eve-online.com/" rel="nofollow">EVE Online</a>. I suppose it's time to shard everything and give away my gold. Getting pretty tired of 40-man instance uber-l00t babies anyway. Don't need new areas to bring out new whine.
item.content:encoded: Eh, I’ll just continue to play EVE Online. I suppose it’s time to shard everything and give away my gold. Getting pretty tired of 40-man instance uber-l00t babies anyway. Don’t need new areas to bring out new whine.

item.title: By: Caffix
item.dc:creator: Caffix
item.description:
Let's hope those paladins are happy now.
But the big news really - three cheers for the arrival of economic meltdown in WoW! :
http://forums.worldofwarcraft.com/thread.aspx?fn=wow-general&t=6518900&p=1&tmp=1#post6518900
Hurray! Also have a look at the unofficial patch notes:
http://www.somethingawful.com/articles.php?a=3479
item.content:encoded:
Let’s hope those paladins are happy now.

But the big news really – three cheers for the arrival of economic meltdown in WoW! :

item.title: By: Valdesta
item.dc:creator: Valdesta
item.description:
Ain't updates fun?
Truthfully tho, being an employer in the software industry (not gaming tho) it boggles my head to think about having to maintain a system that went from 0 to 5 mil users in a year. The bandwidth requirements are crazy (and btw, with correct firewall configs I was getting the download at over 50K/s, not too bad) and WOW the number of servers they must have to maintain...
Of course there are bugs in a new release - they test as much as they can, but there is a point you have to let the code loose, and players/users ALWAYS find bugs. As long as they get fixed quickly (within a week or two is quickly in coding context), that's what counts.
Perhaps it's just because I'm a new player to World of Warcraft (just got it for Christmas), but I feel like sayin' "Don't Bag On Blizzard" :) They're doing the best they can in a very very stressful environment.
They must have a billion new employees just for the WoW project, and it always takes new people about 6-12 months to really 'gel' with the company and be a productive asset. Again, my head is boggling, LOL!
<a href="http://wowgrrl.runescapequizzes.com"/ rel="nofollow">Valdesta</a> Zul'jin - Troll Hunter Silvermoon - Night Elf Rogue
item.content:encoded:
Ain’t updates fun?

Truthfully tho, being an employer in the software industry (not gaming tho) it boggles my head to think about having to maintain a system that went from 0 to 5 mil users in a year. The bandwidth requirements are crazy (and btw, with correct firewall configs I was getting the download at over 50K/s, not too bad) and WOW the number of servers they must have to maintain…

Of course there are bugs in a new release – they test as much as they can, but there is a point you have to let the code loose, and players/users ALWAYS find bugs. As long as they get fixed quickly (within a week or two is quickly in coding context), that’s what counts.

Perhaps it’s just because I’m a new player to World of Warcraft (just got it for Christmas), but I feel like sayin’ “Don’t Bag On Blizzard” 🙂 They’re doing the best they can in a very very stressful environment.

They must have a billion new employees just for the WoW project, and it always takes new people about 6-12 months to really ‘gel’ with the company and be a productive asset. Again, my head is boggling, LOL!

Valdesta
Zul’jin – Troll Hunter
Silvermoon – Night Elf Rogue
